name: Hari Krishna Kosana
title: Senior Dynamics 365 CRM Software Engineer
professional_summary: I am having 10 years of experience in building custom software solutions, with a recent focus on Dynamics 365 CRM and Azure integrations across different industries.
I design Dynamics 365 solutions using Custom Entities and Plugins with C# .NET to solve specific business problems, like managing guest data in hospitality or patient records in healthcare systems.
I configure Azure services such as Logic Apps and Azure Functions to connect CRM data with other systems, which helps automate workflows and reduce manual data entry for users.
I write JavaScript for form validations and business rules within Dynamics 365 to make sure data quality is high, which is very important for domains like banking and government.
I build Power Apps and Power Automate flows to create simple applications for business users, allowing them to update records or get approvals without needing deep technical knowledge.
I set up Azure DevOps pipelines for continuous integration and deployment of our CRM customizations, which makes the release process smoother and more reliable for the whole team.
I test my code thoroughly, including debugging plugins and custom workflows, to find issues early and ensure the system behaves as expected before it goes to production.
I fix performance problems in Dynamics 365, like slow-loading forms or inefficient plugins, by looking at the code and database queries to improve the user experience.
I apply software engineering practices such as code reviews and data structure planning when working on new CRM features, which helps maintain code quality in large projects.
I create technical documentation for the customizations and integrations I build, so that other team members can understand how the system works and support it later.
I participate in team meetings to plan and schedule our work, breaking down big features into smaller tasks that we can deliver in iterations following an Agile approach.
I collaborate with other developers and sometimes business analysts to figure out requirements and turn them into working software within the Dynamics 365 platform.
I learn new Azure services or Dynamics features on the job when a project needs them, which I find challenging but also a good way to grow my technical skills over time.
I assist in data migration tasks, moving customer or operational data into Dynamics 365 while checking for accuracy, which is critical for compliance in healthcare and finance.
I support the systems I build after they go live, investigating any issues users report and providing fixes or workarounds to minimize disruption to their daily work.
I follow security best practices in my code, especially for handling sensitive data in regulated industries, to help meet standards like PCI DSS or HIPAA where applicable.
I adapt my development approach based on the project domain, considering regulations like SOX for banking or FAA guidelines for transportation when designing solutions.
I value writing clean, maintainable code and sharing knowledge with colleagues, as I believe it makes the team stronger and leads to better long-term software outcomes.

responsibilities: I develop custom Dynamics 365 CRM solutions for the hospitality sector, creating plugins with C# .NET to handle complex booking logic and guest data management, which improves reservation accuracy.

I built a suite of Power Automate flows that connect our CRM with external hotel management systems, automating confirmation emails and updating room status, saving front-desk staff several hours each week.
I work on JavaScript validations for CRM forms to ensure data entered for guest preferences and special requests meets our quality standards before it's saved to the database.
I designed a set of custom entities to track guest loyalty programs and service interactions, providing a unified view that helps personalize stays and follow hospitality regulations.
I configured Azure Logic Apps to sync booking data between Dynamics 365 and a legacy property management system, which was a bit tricky but finally got working after a few attempts.
I created Azure Functions in C# for processing real-time notifications from our booking engine, writing the logic to update CRM records and trigger alerts for the operations team.
I set up automated build and release pipelines in Azure DevOps for our CRM customization projects, which reduced deployment errors and made our release cycles more predictable.
I wrote unit tests for our custom plugins and workflows to catch bugs early; I also fixed a stubborn issue where a plugin sometimes failed during high-volume check-in periods.
I help with code reviews for other team members, focusing on Dynamics 365 best practices and performance considerations to keep our customizations efficient and maintainable.
I update our solution architecture documents to reflect new integrations, and I regularly meet with the product team to clarify requirements for upcoming features.
I troubleshoot performance problems in our CRM instance, like a slow-loading dashboard, by analyzing plugin execution and optimizing the underlying database queries.
I assembled a proof-of-concept using Power Apps for mobile staff to update housekeeping status, which the team liked and we plan to roll out to more properties soon.
I check security settings for our CRM and Azure resources to ensure guest personal data is handled properly, aligning with data protection expectations in the hospitality industry.
I put together deployment packages using the Dynamics 365 Solution Framework, making sure all dependencies are included for smooth installation across our development environments.
I started a new module to manage vendor contracts and compliance documents within CRM, defining the entity relationships and starting the plugin development last month.
I finished integrating a payment gateway API using a custom workflow activity, which now processes deposits automatically and posts the transaction record back to the guest's CRM account.
I constructed custom entities and plugins in Dynamics 365 to manage patient referral workflows for a healthcare project, ensuring the system complied with HIPAA data privacy rules.
I produced several Azure Functions that processed HL7 messages from lab systems, transforming the data and creating corresponding records in the CRM for care coordination teams.
I established business rules within Dynamics 365 forms to validate clinical data entry, reducing errors and helping maintain accurate patient information across the care continuum.
I formulated a data migration strategy to move historical patient interaction data into Dynamics 365, using .NET console applications and ensuring data integrity throughout the process.
I authored JavaScript for client-side form scripting to improve the user interface for medical staff, adding conditional field displays and real-time validation logic.
I assembled Power Apps for mobile clinicians to access patient schedules and update visit notes directly, which integrated seamlessly with the main Dynamics 365 backend.
I implemented a series of synchronous and asynchronous plugins to enforce complex business logic around patient consent and authorization tracking within the CRM.
I operated Azure API Management to expose secure endpoints for our CRM data, allowing other internal healthcare applications to retrieve patient demographic information safely.
I solved a difficult debugging issue where a plugin was timing out during bulk appointment creation; I refactored the code and added efficient data queries to fix it.
I contributed to the design of a provider directory module within Dynamics, defining the entity model and relationships to support search and filtering by specialty and location.
I verified all custom code met security standards for protected health information, conducting reviews and working with the compliance team to address any identified gaps.
I maintained the Azure DevOps repository for our project, managing branches and pull requests as our team worked on different features for the healthcare CRM implementation.
I coordinated with the testing team to plan test cycles for our customizations, providing them with documentation and assisting in the creation of test scenarios for user acceptance.
I delivered training sessions for super-users on how to use the new Dynamics 365 features, focusing on the referral workflow and the mobile app we built for clinical staff.
I programmed custom workflows and plugins in Dynamics 365 to handle customer service cases and frequent flyer account management for an airline transportation project.
I devised an integration using Azure Logic Apps to connect CRM with flight operations data, automating the creation of service cases for significant flight delays or cancellations.
I shaped the architecture for a customer feedback module, creating custom entities to track survey responses and link them to specific travel itineraries in the CRM.
I composed C# code for plugins that calculated loyalty points based on fare class and flight distance, updating member accounts in real-time within the Dynamics 365 system.
I installed and configured the Dynamics 365 Solution for our project, managing the deployment across development, testing, and production environments on schedule.
I repaired a critical issue in a legacy .NET web service that fed data into the CRM, improving its error handling and logging after it caused overnight data sync failures.
I tested all API integrations between our custom apps and Dynamics 365, using Postman to simulate various scenarios and ensure reliability for high-volume travel periods.
I organized the codebase for our CRM customizations, applying consistent naming conventions and folder structures so that new team members could understand the project quickly.
I examined performance bottlenecks in the CRM interface used by call center agents, optimizing view filters and indexed fields to reduce screen load times significantly.
I prepared technical specifications for new features requested by the business, such as baggage tracking integration, translating requirements into actionable development tasks.
I supported the go-live of the CRM enhancements, being on-call to address any immediate technical issues and providing quick fixes to keep the customer service operations running.
I documented the data flow and integration points between Dynamics 365 and other airline systems, creating diagrams that helped the infrastructure team understand the connections.
I crafted .NET applications and Dynamics 365 customizations for a government project managing public service requests and citizen case management.
I introduced a plugin to automatically route service requests based on location and department, which helped streamline the assignment process for government agency staff.
I converted several manual paper-based processes into digital workflows within Dynamics 365, using out-of-the-box features and some custom JavaScript for form logic.
I administered the Azure DevOps project, setting up work items and sprint backlogs for our team as we followed an Agile methodology for the government CRM implementation.
I modernized an older .NET Web Forms application by migrating its core functions into a Dynamics 365 model-driven app, improving maintainability and user access control.
I validated data imports from legacy state systems into the new CRM, writing SQL scripts to clean and transform the data before it was loaded into the custom entities.
I safeguarded the application by implementing role-based security within Dynamics 365, ensuring users could only access data relevant to their specific agency and clearance level.
I trained a junior developer on the basics of Dynamics 365 customization and plugin development, pairing with them on a few simpler tasks to build their confidence.
I investigated a recurring error in a workflow that processed license applications, tracing it to a data type mismatch and correcting the code to resolve the issue.
I compiled deployment packages and release notes for each sprint, working with the state's IT operations team to schedule deployments during approved maintenance windows.
I assisted in the development of .NET components that integrated with a financial services CRM to track customer interactions and product inquiries for a banking project.
I formatted and imported large sets of customer data from spreadsheets into the CRM system using .NET console applications I wrote, which helped with a one-time migration effort.
I learned the basics of Dynamics 365 customization on this job, starting with simple tasks like creating new fields and views before moving on to help with basic JavaScript scripting.
I monitored scheduled jobs that synchronized data between the CRM and a core banking system, checking logs and reporting any failures to the senior developer on the team.
I participated in daily stand-up meetings and sprint planning, which was my first real experience with Agile practices in a corporate software development environment.
I cleaned up old code in a shared library, removing unused methods and adding some comments to make it easier for others to use for future CRM integration work.
I reviewed basic functional requirements documents for new CRM features, asking questions to clarify details before starting my assigned coding tasks for the sprint.
I practiced writing unit tests for my .NET code using MSTest, initially finding it difficult but gradually getting better at it with help from more experienced team members.
I worked on a .NET application for a telecommunications project that managed customer device inventory and supported field technician dispatches.
I added new features to an ASP.NET MVC web application based on change requests, such as enhanced search filters and export functionality for inventory reports.
I figured out how to fix bugs in the existing code, like a problem where the application sometimes displayed incorrect service plan details for a customer account.
I tried using AngularJS for a small front-end module to make a parts of the UI more interactive, which was my first exposure to a JavaScript framework at work.
I used ADO.NET for database operations in the application, writing stored procedures and calling them from the C# code to retrieve and update telecom inventory data.
I looked into performance complaints for a slow report, optimizing the SQL query and adding a database index which cut the report generation time down considerably.
